titleStmt.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Habeas Corpus Writ Application

bibl.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Habeas Corpus Writ Application
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: John H. Mc.Graw, J.F. Miller, H.F. Jones
Seattle, Third Judicial of Washington Territory

div1.p: In the district court of the third judicial of washington territory, holding terms at seattle. In the matter of the application of Frank Krebs and Pat Daugherty for a writ of habeas corpus. To the Hon. C.H. Hanford Judge of the above entitled court: The petition of Frank Krebs and Pat Daugherty Respectfully shows: That said imprisoned Frank Krebs Pat Daugherty are unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of their liberty by John H. Mc. Graw Sheriff of the county of King at the jail of said county in the city of Seattle in the Territory of Washington.

That is the icprisonment, deteition, confinement, and restraint are illegal: and that the idlegality thereof consists in this to-wit. That the said Defendants were charged before one J.F. Miller a justice of the peace in and for Seattle precinct in the King County with the crime of Assault and that the said Justice of the peace exceeded his jurisdiction by proceeding to try and determine the said cause and then and there sentencing the said Petitioners to pay a fine of $10.00 each and costs of said causeand then and there committing the said defendants to the custody of the said Sheriff.

Wherefore, your petitioners pray that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said Sheriff commanding him to have the bodies of the said Frank Krebs and Pat Daugherty before your honor at a time and place therein to pbe specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning them, together with the time and cause of their detention, and said writ; and that they may be restored to their liberty. Dated on this 10th, day of October 1889

Frank Krebs Pat Daugherty Senching of Washington ss County of King Frank Krebs and Pat Daugherty each being sworn on his oath deposes and says that he is the petitioner named in the above petition that he has heard the same read, subscribed the same and believes the same to be true. HF Jones Notary Public in and for Washington Territory
